item.description:
NoGlobal is for 2-5 players, and each player takes on a different role—President, policeman, demonstrator, or violent protester—and each role has a different win condition: the President wants to visit three monuments in town, the violent protester has to throw a tart at the President, and so on.

NoGlobal is available for download through Arima.it.

(information from www.boardgamenews.com)

name.value: Doodlebops Get on the Bus! Game

item.description: Based on the children's TV show/performers, this game is a basic roll and move. The goal is to get the Doodlebops characters on the bus in time for their concert. Players try to collect all three Doodlebops instruments - keytar, guitar and drum set along the way. The first player with all the instruments and all the Doodlebops on the bus is a winner. Includes: Game Board, 12 Doodlebops Play Pieces, 12 Instrument Chips, Die and Instructions. No reading is required, Ages 4 and up.

Let's Go To McDonald's Game is a child's game. Players race along a colorful track to be the first to reach McDonald's. The game teaches color recognition and matching, turn taking, and fair play. Each player controls a "Happy Meal Toy" character (Grimace, Birdie the Early Bird, The Hamburgler, and of course, Ronald McDonald himself) and advance along the path avoiding obstacles such as a duck crossing, an open manhole, a skunk, and a broken fire hydrant. Randomly placed tiles along the way will either send you forward or backwards on the path because as the game itself states, "Anything can happen on the way to McDonald's!" The first player to reach the Golden Arches is the winner.

A giant, jungle themed, roll and move game for 2 - 4 players Ages 3 and up. Measures 28" X 38" and is meant to be played on the floor.

This is not the same game as Knizia's King of the Beasts: Mythological Edition.

From the back of the box:

The American quest for fame and fortune. Four different levels of fun to choose from. A real American Made Game. Find security, peace of mind, wealth. Set goals and plan strategies.

An educational board game made to illustrate the destructive nature of addiction. Its mechanics are described by the author as a reverse of games like Monopoly; instead of acquiring wealth, the players lose money, their job, and their possessions throughout the course of play.

From the author's own description:

"Up to [seven] players play at being heroin addicts... the last to lose all his assets is the winner... It was meant as a kind of teaching aid for people who worked for drug programs, or wanted to learn that sort of thing.

"Three to five [players] is ideal... You roll dice and advance to heavier habits ($10/day, $20/day, etc.)
as you spiral inward. There are Hassle and Wisdom cards, when you land on red or green squares, kind of like Chance and Community Chest in Monopoly."

When the player loses his or her job due to varying circumstances, hustles help replace player income. These could be described as variable player powers, because in a sense, different hustles earn a player income in different ways.

As the game progresses, players are likely to acquire more expensive habits which require more money to maintain, as well as suffering the loss of their job, arrests by law enforcement, and negative conseqences of board spaces. The player who survives the longest is declared the winner, though the true goal of the game is to show that getting involved in the real-life junkie game is always a losing proposition.
Pizza Pests-A Pizza-building Card Game for Pizza Lovers. Memory-Matching Game where cards are designed like pizza slices.

The "Fun-Full" Thrift Game is designed to teach good saving principles. It consists of fifteen pairs of cards and one odd card. The cards display text that promotes the value of saving money.
The cards are all dealt to the players. Play consists of drawing a card from the player on the right to match cards in the acting players hands. The player with the odd card left at the end of the game is the loser.

3 to 5 players go on a hunt together. Since there are no agreements over the required spears, axes or torches needed, a successful end to the hunt is uncertain.

If the hunt fails, a fight occurs, instead of getting loot from the hunt.

In order to get home safely, players need to still have a few clubs ready to protect themselves.

In Sárkányvár (Dragon's Castle) the players can take role of one of the 6 characters: archer, barbarian, dwarf, etc.
The game is separated into two parts: in the first, you will have to collect your equipment (weapons, magical items, food, etc.), and in the second you can explore the castle of the dragon, find treasures, fight monsters or the dragon itself. The game ends when one of the players finds the lost scepter (or optionally you can play until you defeat the dragon), and the winner is the one who has the most gold pieces.

Can be played as a cooperative game too.

item.description:
From Games et al and used with permission:
This is a truly fun game manufactured by C W Faulkner & Co in 1899 and is a race game covering the, then, popular hobby of cycling. Falulkner produced a series of games similar to Bikee called the ‘Upidee Series’ Cards are laid out to provide the course and the use of a teetotum provides the means of movement. This game consists of up to six cyclists, two dice, the rules and 20 illustrated course cards. The bottom of the box lists other games by Faulkner.

Note: Rules stipulate teetotum but d6 die is pictured with game in BGG gallery. Another ebay sale has images showing a four-sided teetotum with sides numbered 1-4.

Coloured balls are drawn at random from the bag and placed onto the board, filling up all the spaces.

Each player then draws one coloured figure at random to determine which coloured balls they will control and places it in one of the four home areas.

Some neutral coloured balls are then removed depending on the number of players before the game begins.

Players take turns moving either one of their own balls or a neutral ball and the game ends when one player gets all of their own coloured balls into their home area.

An Exciting New Board Game that Incorporates Military Strategy and Economic Manipulation

Every territory generates one of 7 products. Every round of 7 turns you collect cash for what you own. This cash is used to build armies, navies and missiles, as well as finance moves and wars.

Start out as small tribes, scattered all over the world. Your resources are limited. Create armies and expand into city-states, grabbing high-value product. Convert this product into war materials.

As you conquer more territories you gain more resources. Claim countries and get bonuses. Build up your defenses. Protect your sea lanes with navies. Send out marines to claim new territories and islands.

As you grow, so do your opponents. Clashes are inevitable. Everyone wants the high-value product. Wars break out. Missiles fly.

When you reach super-power status, with an inventory of nuclear and conventional missiles, natural barriers are no longer a problem. You have the resources to launch large-scale attacks.

There is no randomness to a battle. As in chess, the attacker always wins. But your opponent may see a gap in your defenses and turn the tables on you. You could win a battle but lose the war.

Should you build your defenses? Or attack your opponent when he's weak? Remember, he who strikes first has the advantage.

Grow your empire and dominate the world!

Home Page: http://www.ajcraft.net

item.description:
"Dora, David and Dorothy are donkeys: but not any old kind of donkey, special donkeys. They are really little golden donkeys. With a bit of luck they are happy to give away some of their precious treasures. Therefore you have to have some luck and uncover the right cards..."

Players reveal tiles that instruct them to collect one of three colored donkeys. In subsequent turns, the donkeys will move from owner to owner until the "we give you coins" tile is turned up. At this point, players collect coins for any donkeys that are in front of them. The game also comes with tiles to use with "elder players." Even with the additional tiles, the game is purely chance. But children will need to interpret the new directions (ex: all donkeys move to the left).

Children learn colors, taking turns, counting to three, and simple directions (left/right).

item.description: This is a party game focused on the mechanic of team's guessing humorous rhymed pairs of words. In alternating turns, each team's clue giver selects a card and begins describing the two word rhyme using words and/or pantomime (like in charades). When the correct rhyme is guessed, the clue giver draws another card, with the goal being to guess as many rhymes in 60 seconds. Examples of rhyming pairs of words include: "Pooch Smooch," "Moose Juice," "Jet Sweat" and so on.

name.value: See It and Sign It American Sign Language game

item.description:
From the publisher:

The SEE IT and SIGN IT Game by Bill & Bud, Inc. is an easy-to-follow game that teaches ASL, (American Sign Language,) the fun way! It's 6 games in one, plus a DVD with live action demonstrations. Each of the included 60 word cards shows how to sign a different word, and the Secret Decoder Lenses reveals the hidden word on the back of each card. The game includes 10 two-sided game boards that allow players to with either just 30 words first or all 60 words. Six different games can be played with the cards and game boards. Winner of Dr. Toy Award for ten best socially responsible products.

This is a game aimed pre-teens and teens using the theme of "High School Musical" Players compete to make it through East High School(represented on the game board) to be the first to collect six different cast cards while trying to avoid detention. Players succeed by answering trivia questions or singing/dancing along with an included interactive music CD.

Brilliantly designed game presents 3 ways to play. Traditional dominoes, build your own dominoes where players create their tiles each turn, and a 2 dimensional version where players can build up as they go. Includes 56 squares and 16 connector joints.

Don't know much about this game as my Polish is quite awful.
(Perhaps one of the polish BGG members can help out here).

Anyway Top-Gun is a game about Jet Air-Combat between NATO/Warsaw Pact Fighters. Game contains a sheet of counters that have to be cut out, a map with squares (instead of hexes) and several data sheets about specific aircraft. Also included are about 10 small pages of rules and 3 dice. Overall the game doesn't look too complex.

A horse riding game for up to six players based on 3 Day eventing, Dressage & Cross Country.

The Dressage phase of the game is played with 2 dice - one denoting how many squares the competitor should move & the other the results of that move.

The Dressage & Cross Country phases in Double Event can be played as independent games or the scores combined for a Double Event.

From the creators of International Jump Off.

Tenacety is an extremely entertaining card game suitable for the whole family. It is played on a peg board & utilizes only the 10's, Jacks, Queens, Kings & Aces of a pack of cards - hence the name Ten-ace-ty !

The game ends when one player has managed to remove all 5 of his pegs from the pegboard having won tricks containing those cards he had originally pegged.

Great family card game, simple to learn & play !

Contents

1 x Playing board
20 x Playing cards (10's, Jacks, Queens, Kings & Aces)
20 x Pegs in 4 colours
Rules on reverse of box

Board consists of a trail with three separate parts. A central part, where the players must combine 5 balls in two colors to match the pattern they have at hand, and a left and right section with three balls each, where the players put the balls to feed the central section.

Very similar (if not identical) to Aya

Calculus is a strategic connection game between black and white. Players alternate pushing stones of their colour onto the board. There is no grid - stones may be pushed to anywhere on the board. When touching stones enclose an area the majority of stones on the perimeter of that area decide who controls the area. It is illegal to create an area which has the same number of black and white stones on its perimeter. Stones that are part of the perimeter of an area are immobilized, but the rest may be pushed again instead of introducing a new stone. The winning player is one who connects their edges of the board.

There is no standard shape of board and no standard stone. You can use a tree stump and real stones if you wish. I prefer to use circular stones.

Calculus may be reproduced for non-commercial purposes.

Power Point files with the rules and a sample game are posted in the files section of this page. (An additional rule up for discussion is posted in the forum: "Arguements about touching".)

link.value: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

item.description:
This is an educational Ages 8 and up game designed to teach business concepts like: global markets, return on investment, fixed-cost ratios, etc. as well as teaching skills like math, geography, negotiation, trading and communication. 
 Each player assumes the role of Will Trader, an enterprising duck who aspires to build his Cracker Mills all over the world. Players compete by developing businesses, making investments, and other similar actions while circling the gameboard.

name.value: Pyramid Scheme: Legend of the Pharaohs

item.description: This is an abstract strategy game which utilizes a theme of ancient Egypt. Pyramid Scheme: Legend of the Pharaohs can be played by 2 or 3 alternating players or teams of players. Each begins the game with a Base Pyramid comprised of 9 pieces (8 Soldiers and 1 Guardian). Each player's objective is to capture the playing pieces and ultimately, raid and capture the Treasure Chamber within the Base Pyramid of the opponents.

From the publisher:

Xemorpheum (pronounced Zemorpheum) was specifically designed to teach Third World business concepts to students and business people. The game models a Third World Business environment in an ancient coliseum setting in a far off country called Richmania."

Xemorpheum is played by two to seven players who compete against each other by rolling dice, moving around a coliseum track, drawing cards and paying crossing fees to other players or to the treasury. Players increase their chance of winning by amassing cash, building factories and training arenas, and assembling armies. To win, one player must avoid sudden death bankruptcy and gather more wealth and power than other players while surviving the myriad of hazards, traps and pitfalls inherent in the game's unique playing environment."

This is a roll and move type trivia game with the added twist of pursuing, fighting and capturing villains. The game is based on the comic book character "Batman" by DC comics. It includes 1000 questions covering 65 years and multiple decades of Batman history.

Depending on the space the player lands on, when the player answers a question correctly they receive a power card that gives them bonuses to being either a) Batman or b) a villain. If the player answers a question correctly from a villain space, they receive a villain card. The player must then make his way to the currently upturned location card. Once there, the player attempts to "capture" the villain by using power cards against the player sitting next to them with the added luck of a dice roll for each. When a player captures 3 villains, he wins the game.

The question cards each include 5 questions representing 5 difficulty levels. i.e.:

1. Batman's secret identity is what playboy billionaire?
2. True or false. The Wayne manor grandfather clock is set to the time of death of Bruce Wayne's parents.
3. After the Grasshopper stole the batmobile, batman installed an alarm to ensure it never happened again. What villain was subsequently tripped up by that alarm?
4. Selina Kyle's brother Karl is better known as whom?
5. Several incarnations of the batmobile were designed by what stuntman?

As you can see, the questions get progressively harder.

This is a roll-and-move style trivia game based on the city of Omaha, Nebraska (USA). The trivia questions are based on local features of the city of Omaha and surrounding area, and are in 5 categories: Sports, History, Entertainment, Arts, and General Trivia. The game includes 4 Movers, 10-Second Timer, 4 Score Cards, 1 Die, game board, and 320 Question Cards with 1,600 questions.

Loosely themed on the Walt Disney Movie "102 Dalmations," this is a children's game where the players compete to be the first to get rid of their "spots" by placing them on Oddball the dog. Rolling the oversized plastic dice tells how many spots to affix dog-side. If you roll Cruella on the dice, however, then Oddball or another player gives up some spots to you. Ages 4 and up.

A simple betting game, based on the roll of three standard 6-sided dice held within a turnable cage.

From the printed rule sheet:
"You may invite any number of people to play. The first step is to set out your equipment and select a person to be Banker. The Banker pays off all bets for any agreed number of plays or time limit at the completion of which another player acts as Banker.
All numbers on the layout do not have to be sold. For example, only two or three people may participate in a single play. The profit percentage is exactly the same as if all numbers were covered. 
When all bets are down on the layout, the Banker gives the cage a turn which raises and drops the dice at the opposite end of the cage. The three numbers on the top surface of the dice are the winners. 
If a bettor's number appears on one die he receives the return of his stake plus a like amount (even money). If it appears on 2 dice he is rewarded with the return of his bet plus twice the amount bet (2 to 1). Three like numbers rewards the players with thrice the amount bet plus the bet (3 to 1).
Lowe's CHUCK-A-LUCK is an exact duplicate of the regulation casino game. It has all the play features of the larger size game and will give players the same high degree of enjoyment."

Subtitled: A Race round Britain. Amusing, Thrilling, and Instructive
This is a very simple race game designed to help people learn the geography of coastal England, Scotland, and Ireland. Think of it as Snakes and Ladders in a circle. Players roll, move, and could hit an obstacle or movement bonus depending on their move.

name.value: Bullets & Ballots: A Learning Game on Central America

item.description:
This game is designed to give its players first-hand experience with the problems confronting the countries of Central America and with difficult U.S. policy choices in the region. Between 20 and 40 players (this is obviously a classroom game) participate in a simulation of real-world political struggles and conflicts that will raise fundamental issues about Central America and the role of the US in the region.

The game consists of four 15-minute periods of activity followed by a debriefing and policy discussion. Players are divided into five teams: the Guatemalan Government, the Army/Wealthy Class, the Guerrillas, the Peasants/Workers, and the US Government. An initial 15-minute Strategy Session within each team is followed by three 15-minute months of an electoral campaign involving discussions and negotiations among the teams.

Each team presents a brief Position Statement to start the action. Over the course of the campaign, each team may use means ranging from moral persuasion to military force in pursuit of its goals. The Army/Wealthy Class and the Guerrillas may opt to launch offensives. The Army can take over at any time, and they also have the option to "silence" members of any of the other Guatemalan teams. At the end, the team in power has the option of holding an election. All Guatemalans except silenced members and guerrillas are eligible to vote. Peasants/Workers have two votes; others have one. Guerrillas may vote by joining the Peasants.

link.value: Roosevelt Center for American Policy Studies

item.description:
This is another game in the Haba Mini-Spiel series for children. Players start with one monkey, one coconut, and one banana playing piece. On a turn, the player rolls a die to determine what kind of piece the player will try to take from one opponent. In order to steal the piece, however, the player must guess which hand their opponent has hidden the piece. The first player to receive three of any playing piece wins.

The game teaches shape recognition and counting to three.

spielaffe
spielaffe

A new Swedish CCG.

Novel or unusual features include non-rectangular cards(!), comparatively small decks, and combat resolution by special twelve-sided "tactics" and "combat" dice.

Official homepage: http://www.draim.com/arena

name.value: Lascaux: Η Σπηλιά με τις Ζωγραφιές

item.description:
Lascaux is a game about the French caves containing animal paintings; discovered in 1940 by four teenagers.

This auction game is based on the bidding mechanism of Michael Schacht's Mogul also implemented in No Thanks!

The deck consists of 54 cards each representing one of six animals and a combination of two colors. At the beginning of a round, cards are turned face up until all six colors are showing or seven cards are face up. All players secretly decide which color cards they hope to win at the end of the round. On their turn, players bid by placing a stone on the table. If a player passes, he picks up all the stones currently on the table and places his token on top of the token pile. The last player remaining grabs all the cards of the color he had chosen earlier in the round. The second to last player, whose token now sits at the top of the token pile, then picks up all the cards of his chosen color if any cards of that color are left. The same process is repeated for each player when their token is at the top of the token pile. The game ends when all the cards of the deck have been claimed. Players then earn points for each animal for which they have majority.

Components: 54 cards, 50 stones, 30 markers, rules.

Released: Essen 2007.

item.description:
Strategic treatment of the Franco Prussian War with 12 two-weeks turn, a point-to-point map and an easy to play system for movement and combat (with tons of dice rolling on the way).
Similar to GDW's A House Divided, with rules for the Paris Commune, battlefield promotions, cavalry screening, siege combat and surrenders.
It's a DTP wargame with a 4A4 full color map and 192 full counters.
Available as a print & play wargame through wargamedownloads or as a laser-printed DTP from Boulder Games.
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=582

There are two versions of Oust. One is played on a hex grid, and the other is played with a Go set. Players take turns adding their stones to the board. When you form a (horizontal or vertical in the square grid version) connection between your newly added stone and one or more of your on-board stones, you form a larger group. You can only make such a move if said larger group will connect with an enemy group upon its creation, and if said larger group is larger than all of the enemy groups it connects to. Then all those enemy groups are removed, and you must add another stone while it is still your turn. If all of your opponent’s on-board stones are removed from the board via capture, you win.

item.description:
From the website:

Inside Blitz is a football simulation like no other. After playing many others in my life I set out to take all the good and get rid of all the bad I saw in those games. That along with some innovative game play makes this game something special. The game play is simple yet captures every aspect of the game of football. Players perform just like they did in the season recreated. Using a combination of Fast Action Cards and dice plays develop using the personnel on the field. Your linemen can get called upon to make a play, the defensive secondary may have to stop the run or your linebackers may have to break up a pass. If it is inside the game of football it is in Inside Blitz.

With defensive players rated in 7 categories, you can see the strengths and weaknesses of all the players. From coverage skills in four depths of passes to their run defense you will see the weak links. Not all pass rushers and ball hawking DBs were created the same and here you will see who those players are.

Linemen, receivers and runners are rated for run and pass blocking. Your sieve of an offensive line will allow more pressure while those staunch linemen will protect your QB like Fort Knox. You will see the blockers blast running lanes or fail to get room for your runners.

Quarterbacks have 4 different throwing depths so the deep ball guys will perform as such. Those dump off guys will get their shots downfield but when pressured they will look to their comfort dink passes. The pass rush and scrambling system can really bring out the anticipation of those type plays as well.

Receivers are rated for pass catching ability in three depths down the field. All receivers have their own 6x6 cards for each depth of pass with the ability to bust one for a longer gain if they can get loose.

Runners are rated for inside and outside running making each runner completely different. Along with each players own 6x6 card for each type of run you will see where the home-run-hitter type runners will get the all or nothing yards while your consistent bull of a back will get his yards no matter but don’t expect a big one.

You have never seen a solitaire system like this one! Play calling takes into account down, distance and the style of play of both the offense and defense. Using all this also gets defensive platoons into the game without any hassle on the gamers part. The distribution of who gets the ball is taken care of with ease. You won’t be seeing a bomb to your clod-footed TE but your track star will be targeted more often at that depth.

Special teams, penalties and propensity to fumble are not overlooked in this game. Each coverage team is given ratings to reflect the way they played on the season. Teams are rated separately for penalties which is a very important aspect of football that gets glossed over with many games. Finally each player is given their own fumble rating to show how each player took care of the ball.

All this is presented in a professional and quality way making Inside Blitz the game of the new generation. Come on inside!
Command the forces of the atomic world as you battle the strength of your opponent's elements and compounds. Use the properties of chemical reactions to build strategies and defeat your foe.

This German game is for Ages 4 and up. The players must move around the board trying to finish the tasks they need to do before going to bed. 
predecessor of: 'Das Gute-Nacht-Spiel' http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/110492/das-gute-nacht-spiel

At the dawn of time, man emerged from the cave and wanted something to do.

So they invented a sport: Rockball. The rules of this game are long lost to the passing years, but you can recreate the thrill and excitement of being a Rockball team manager. Recruit athletes with bribes – bones, rocks, sticks and meat – but draft carefully; only the smart leader will build the best team.

item.description: Each card has one word from a well-known nursery rhyme. The object is to collect sets of three cards that complete one phrase from a nursery rhyme, e.g., "Little Miss Muffett, "Jack and Jill," "Hickory Dickory Dock," etc. The first player to complete three sets of three wins.

La Grande Parade is a memory-based circus-themed children's (and parents') game.

Every player will try to gather the highest number of cards within every category. Categories include Clowns, Magicians, Bears, and so on.

The "difficulty" of the game is in deciding when to stop picking cards from a category and begin a new one. In fact, if you cannot stop a category, go for another one and then come back to the first.

As an example: the first card is a bear, then a clown is revealed. By taking the clown, it will not be possible to take bear-cards anymore (the category is closed). So that's why a player is free to leave a card instead of taking it, which makes his turn end.

When there are no cards left on the table, or none that anyone can take, the game ends and the biggest collection wins.

Published in Japan, Miracle Five is an advanced version of Go-Moku. As in Gomoku, the aim is to get five of your pieces in a row. Unlike Gomoku, some of the pieces can be moved on the specially-designed board.
 It was designed by Goro Hasegawa, who, according to the game box and website, was the inventor of Othello.

item.description:
Marinva! is a memory and dexterity game. The "board" is a 7x7 grid of hidden cards that the players must reveal to make identical couples. But the shape and colors of the drawings are specially designed for a hard recognition and confuse the memory. In addition, there are special cards that force the players to make fast moves with his hands (applaud, hit the table...) for win extra turns, change the situation on the table or reveal new cards.

"Marinva!, el joc" is a non-commercial game, published in Spain for "Marinva, Jocs i educació" (www.marinva.es), catalonian company dedicated to introduce the gaming in the world of education, for celebrate his 10th anniversary.

Marinva! es un juego de memoria y rapidez de reacción orientado a público adulto. Sobre un tablero de 7x7 cartas ocultas, los jugadores deberán descubrirlas para formar parejas idénticas. Pero los motivos geométricos y colores de las cartas están especialmente diseñados para dificultar su reconocimiento y crear confusión. Además, hay cartas especiales con las que los jugadores pueden robarse el turno entre ellos, pueden cambiar de sitio en la mesa o destapar más de una carta si son los más rápidos al hacer determinados gestos con las manos (aplaudir, golpear la mesa...).

"Marinva, el joc" fue editado en España como obsequio con motivo del décimo aniversario por "Marinva, Joc i educació" (www.marinva.es), empresa catalana dedicada a introducir el juego en el mundo educativo.

This set building card game comes in a beautiful round tin and has die cut cards. The gems are just thin card stock. 
From the back of the tin:
Choose your Gemstone and battle your opponents to find the missing pieces of your treasure map in this swashbuckling card game. You may be the most notorious pirate around, but beware the Hurricane, Skull and Black Spot Cards that may hinder your passage across the high seas. Collect gold booty as you go and use it to bargain for the treasure map cards that will lead you to victory. Always remember, never trust a fellow pirate - it's every seafarer for himself. And may the bravest Pirate win!

item.description: A spin and move game for 2 to 4 players, based on the ABC television series of the same name. Comes with game board, 4 player pawns, spinner, and 32 cards.

"From far away you can hear the loud meowing of the cats. If you can guess how many cats' eyes will twinkle at you, you can join in the singing of the cats.

But, beware of the big dog ..."

Another game in the HABA Mini-Spiel line. Players roll a die that determines how many cat faces they are hoping to match. Players then toss a handful with as many cats (one blank side, one face side) as they choose into the air. If they are successful, they keep a cat face. Play continues until a player has gathered three cats.

This children's game teaches turn taking, counting up to four, and simple probability.
Picture-chits are concealed beneath colored disks. Players roll a color-die and try to remember which picture is hidden under the disk of the color rolled.

name.value: The Witcher: The Adventure Card Game
The Witcher: El juego de cartas de las aventuras de Geralt de Rivia

item.description:
Wiedzmin: Przygodowa Gra Karciana (The Witcher: Adventure Card Game) bases on the bestselling Polish novel written by Andrzej Sapkowski and computer games "The Witcher" created by CD Projekt RED. The players hire an unbeatable warrior, Geralt the witcher, to kill monsters which ravage the countryside. The players have to use special abilities of Geralt's friends, collect attack cards, events cards and gold.

The game contains the following components:

- 110 cards
- 24 gold tokens
- Geralt marker
- a money-bag
- the rulebook

item.description:
Text from the introduction in the rules:
The witches keenly stare at the magic bowl.... in a few seconds the magic symbols will appear. The witches are as quiet as mice and even the cauldron has stopped bubbling. Finally the symbols can be clearly recognized. Immediately the witches yell their magic spells, as only the quickest witch to shout the correct spell will become the new superior witch!

This is one of Haba's Tumble-dice games, characterized by using dice in a domed container, a clever way of ensuring the dice don't get separated and lost.

The contents of the game are:
- A clear-domed tumbler with seven red six-sided dice (each die with 2 cats, 2 bats and 2 brooms) and one die with one, two or three black dots, or one, two or three red dots on its six sides. 
- One orange wooden witch meeple
- 30 cards showing either a scene with many witches or a scene with one witch. The backs of the card show the face of one of three different witches. 
- The rules.

The tumbler is placed in the centre and seven cards are dealt face up around the tumbler. The witch piece is placed on any card and during the game only moves in a clockwise direction. The player whose turn it is shakes the dice and all players simultaneously try to see what spell is indicated and which they must recite. The spell to recite is determined by where the witch lands. The die with one to three spots in two colours determines where the witch lands. If it is a card with many witches, the players must recite the spell corresponding to the type of animal that appears the most times on the dice. If it is a card with one witch, the players must recite the spell corresponding the type of animal that appears the least number of times on the dice. The first player to recite the correct spell gets to keep the card that the witch was standing on. The witch then moves clockwise the number of steps indicated on the pipped die and a new card is placed in the space vacated by the witch.

The winner is the first player to get three of the same witch (on the card backs) or any five witches.
 The rules provide for a professional variation, where the colour of the dots, either black or red, on the pipped die makes a difference. The cards have little signposts with a black star or red mushroom. The movement of the witch will then be in the direction of the red star or red mushroom accordingly .

This is a trivia/brainteaser type game marketed for children. Includes 200 Noodle Booster challenge cards, 80 tokens, 6 "Take a Chance" cards, and a one minute timer.

From the publisher: "The game designed by Gifted Program educators.Testing to identify gifted students is based on higher-level cognitive processes and to a large extent children are poorly prepared due to little or no exposure to such subject matter. Noodle Booster exposes players to these concepts and techniques in a fun format. Studies and research demonstrate that a child's performance will increase significantly by merely becoming familiar with the concepts."

name.value: Treasure Trot: The Bella Sara board game

item.description:
Enter the world of Bella Sara. Have you met Bella, Thunder, Jewel and Fiona? Choose your favorite, then use a die or your own Bella Sara horse cards to move your horse along a colorful winding trail of adventure. The first player to collect three treasure sets wins the game!

Featuring a double-sided game board, younger players can choose the easy, fast-play version and learn color recognition, counting, and problem solving.

Want more of a challenge? Flip the board over for the more strategic advanced-play version. Treasure Trot includes the exclusive Bella Sara horse card, Apuni. This one-of-a-kind card is only available in the Treasure Trot game. Giddy-up!

In ancient Rome, tribunes were highly esteemed individuals elected by the people to represent them politically and militarily. In the board game Tribune: Primus Inter Pares, players take on the role of a powerful and ambitious patrician family. By applying influences and manipulating controls over the various factions, they attempt to pave their way to victory in order to attain the high office of the tribune.

From the mind of the highly acclaimed designer of Die Macher, Karl-Heinz Schmiel, the gameplay in Tribune is a combination of worker placement and set collection. Each round the players take turns by positioning their followers on the board to garner cards, achieve objectives and/or attempt to take over factions. In order to gain control of a faction and to utilize its benefits, one must play a set of cards from that specific group. That person will remain in command of the faction until someone else stages a successful take-over by having another set that is either of higher quantity or higher sum of values.

Victory is achieved when a player has met the required number of objectives as specified on the victory condition card selected at the start of the game, which is dependent on the number of participants. Alternatively, you can choose to forego the use of a condition card and play with the point-value option. In this variant, the game ends when someone has collected a certain number of the faction markers and the winner is the one with the highest scores as determined by the points assigned to each achievement.

item.description:
Check your 6! is an air combat simulation of the 1925-1947 era and can be played with any aircraft from this era, including the early jets.

Movement is planned ahead and simultaneous. This makes the game very suitable to play with many players. It uses a maneuver template similar in form to Blue Max / Canvas Eagles.

CY6 requires airplane models which can be of any scale - 1/72, 1/144, 1/300 or 1/600 - and a hexagonal mapboard. Or it can be played with cardboard counters on a hexboard.

Individual pilot skills matters in this game. As Chuck Yeager said: "It's the man, not the machine!".

link.value: Battles Above: WWII Air War Scenarios
Check Your 6! Falcon of the Duce
Check Your 6! Guadalcanal: The Cactus Air Force
Check Your 6! Over the Channel: Battle of Britain
Colorful Skies: WWI Air War Scenarios

item.description:
In this mafia game players are different gangsters travelling around the world. The object of the game is to deliver three kills and $100,000 cash to godfather in Palermo.

There are different squares on game board which have their own decks of cards. There are MAFIA-, DOLLAR- INTERPOL- and LAW-cards. Each deck contains different action cards. Two cards are special: Mafia War and Razzzia! Mafia War sets one player to attempt to travel to Palermo while other players try to kill him. Razzzia! makes player to lose all their dirty cash.

Sandtrap Golf is a new fun interactive game.

The game has 54 golf ball playing cards in a handy round tin that easily stores in your bag.

The cards have all the shots in the game including hole in ones, double eagles, birdies, bogies, snowmen, lost balls and of course, mulligans .

The object of the game is to turn over your playing cards first, with the lowest score while forcing your opponents to keep as many face down cards as possible.

The rules are simple and easy to learn.
Best played with 2 to 4 players.

Play 9 or 18 holes anytime, anywhere with anyone.

There are 110 playing cards with a Stroke, Bonus Stroke (eagles & birdies) and Penalty (hazard & OB) cards.

The object is to score as low as possible on each hole by exchanging Face Up and Face Down cards as soon as possible while avoiding a forced final putt.

Any game that you can play on the course, can be played with the Arnold Palmer Card Game.
If your game is heads up nine or eighteen holes, Skins, Match Play or 36 or 72 hole tournament play, this game is for you.

Each game contains 110 playing cards, rules, score pad, golf tee and scoring pencil and up to 6 players can play.

Epoque is a futuristic wargame system which deals about battles between three futuristic factions.

Main battle units in Epoque are M.A.P.S., huge mechanical armours. The battle system uses proprietary 1/48 scale models for M.A.P.S. and 30mm miniatures (for infantry), plus various support vehicles.

The rule set allow players to use other models and miniatures in the game.

Learn to play the percentages – quite literally – with this tennis board game.

Players simulate a real match by spinning the wheel, picking a card and learning their fate. Just like real life, there’s also some rolling of the dice involved. It’s not all luck, however – winning consistently requires mastering the strategies behind the game.
HysteriCoach Hockey is an edition of HysteriCoach for the Canadian and American market. It has a new graphic design. Some rules are changed from the original version, fitting better Hockey rules.

item.description:
The 2006 edition of Tempête sur l'Échiquier (Knightmare Chess) by Variantes contains both Knightmare Chess and Knightmare Chess 2 all in one. In total 140 cards in color.

Knightmare Chess adds a whole new element of unpredictability to the occasionally stale game of standard Chess by giving players cards that they can play before, after, or sometimes instead of their turns. Big fun for an evening of relaxed Chess play, recommended for chaos lovers.

item.description: In Ratsutalli (Finnish for "horse stable") you move around the board answering horse-oriented questions which gain you chips that you use to buy riding equipment in the "purchase squares". He who first manages to collect a predetermined amount of equipment wins the game.

2 to 4 teams of minimum of 2 people play against each other. They try to get as much points as possible by finishing assignments.

The team trows a die and the number decides what assignment they get. For every successfully finished assignment the team gets the assignment-card, which counts as 1 point. The green, red and blue cards are normal cards, the golden cards are special "Gouden Loeki"-cards.

The assignments can be slogans, drawing, trivia ect. The game is themed around popular commercials.

Subtitled: The New Mechanical Race Game
This is a children's version of the many mechanical horse racing games popular for the last 200 years. This one was manufactured in England by Glevum Games. The game involves pulling the horses in a jerky action to propel them forward. The horses are mounted on flat metal stand that are attached by metal clips to the table. Instructions are printed in the lid.

Because it's a children's version, it doesn't include the wagering common in most games of this type.

Subtitled: The Thrilling Card Game Based on Popular Darts

This simple 52-card game published in England allows players to compete in a game of darts. Sized the same as a pack of standard playing cards with a rules sheet included.

From the back of the box:
Learn about shapes in this fun game with a popular fairy talk theme. Feel for the magic shape 'bean' in the bag and if it matches one of your cards you can build the beanstalk for Jack to climb. You'll have to avoid the giant to win!

item.description:
Taiwan: Assassin's Mace, Scorpion Sting is a two player game simulating a hypothetical People's Republic of China's invasion of the Republic of China (Taiwan).
Features the problems of a sea/air invasion against a hostile foe.

A print and play, hex and counter wargame available for free.
Available as a single PDF from http://www.mmiparchive.papermakeit.com/28%20-%20Boardgames.html

Prepare For Battle!

Beams of coherent light slice through the ships hull as her captain barks out orders to his crew. We're not out of this yet, all stop, bring us about and ready all forward batteries to fire on my mark... Fire!

Firing Solution is a table top fleet level tactical space combat and campaign game where player field fleets of ships, sending them into battle against their enemies.

Highlights:

 Space combat your way... In two or three dimensions on hex grids or measured using any flat playing surface, all without complicated rules or math.
 Easily field fleets of ships in battle using any of the 30+ included ships or quickly design your own using the included construction rules.
 Damage types and defenses use a rock / paper / scissors approach with each damage type having an appropriate defense. Empires may specialize in particular technologies but no single vessel can excel at everything.
 Tactical Data Link squadrons, Escorts, other special equipment and ship orders add considerable depth to fleet tactics.
 Command an empire in its struggle for galactic dominance with the included campaign system based on colony control and infrastructure.
 The combination of ship elevation and roll status with directional defenses, individual weapon firing arcs and dorsal, ventral or spinal mounting options bring 3D battlefields to life without vectors or other complex math.
 Enhance weapons by adding various weapon effects such as barrage, slow arming or spinal mount to alter their capabilities.
 Unique damage system scales the severity of each weapon attack allowing larger vessels to dispatch small ships more easily while smaller vessels need to wear down larger targets with repeated strikes.
 Use one of the four included Empires or create your own using a simple system allowing the creation of empires tailored to your favorite setting.
 And Much More.




Format:
68 Page PDF with Separate Front/Back Cover PDF
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=583

Swedish trivia game, based on a famous TV show, this game from the 1970's or 1980's is played with one die that have different colors, a block for points and question cards. You roll the dice, answer a question, if you are right you may stay and take the points you are on, or continue to earn more points. If you answer wrong you get 0 points.

Categories are:
History
Geography
Animal/Nature
Science
Sports
Entertainment.

Answer questions in five separate categories as you relive the magical moments from the life and career of Elvis Aaron Presley. Correct answers earn players gold record albums. Be the first to return to Graceland with a collection of five different albums and you win the game.

Superstar Chess was invented by László Polgár, Hungarian chess master coach. It is a hexagonal chess variant, created mainly for educational purposes.
The board consists of 37 hexes and each player has 1 king, queen, rook, knight, bishop and 5 pawns.
The rules can be found on the author's homepage (http://www.polgar-superstar-chess.net) or in the 'files' section of this page.

"It is quick and interesting and a lot of creative, brilliant games will be played with it." - Leon Pliester Ph.D., International Master of Chess

McDonald’s PlayPlace Game is a children's game in which players follow a colorful track leading to and through a three dimensional game board resembling a McDonald's PlayPlace. Players start at home and follow a path to the PlayPlace. Once there, they must turn their token over, indicating that they have removed their shoes, before they can continue. The first player to go through the PlayPlace, put their shoes back on, and make it home is the winner.

On the path there are some arrows that lead forward and some that lead backward. Players advance by spinning a color wheel and moving to the indicated color.

item.description:
Players divide themselves into two teams. Each team begins with $500,000, 5000 fans, and a set of playing pieces. They decide which team will be the home team and the game begins. The standard rules of baseball apply.

Both teams ante $50,000 every inning. The ante increases by $25,000 every three innings. The team that scores more runs in the inning will win this pot. The pot rolls over if both teams score an equal number of runs.

Before the result of an at bat is rolled, the defensive team may move its playing pieces on the gameboard to indicate its defensive position. The offensive player rolls the icosikaidihedron, a 22-sided die, to determine the result of the at bat. If a base runner is in the first, second or ninth batting position then the offensive player may try for a stolen base. The game gives the offensive player a fifty-fifty chance of success for a stolen base.

Certain events will allow either team to move its token along the Franchise gameboard. Fans are won and lost here.

The game is over when the baseball game is complete. All fans won by the teams are worth $10 each. The team with more money has won.

This game is made up of a large dome ( 10" diameter) shaped like a Gumball Machine. First you fill the outer part of dome with gum balls, then you insert a penny - which puts one of the gumballs into play. You then use all the skill you can to maneuver the gumball to the center hole- if you get it there.. it delivers the gum ball down the chute to you! The TV commercial jingle that was featured in the advertising for this game said : "You pay, you play, you chew away, and save pennies everyday".

This is a simple roll and move horse racing game, with the added dimension that the horses need to clear the steeples. The first version I know of is a 1901 edition, but I've only seen a postcard advertising it and not the actual game. There have been a wood version circa 1930 and a paper version date unknown. This list of versions, however, is by no means definitive.

A very cheap version but with the same idea as Jaques’ Ascot. The game consists of a box that houses five card horses and riders: Tom, Dick and Harry – Gert and Daisy as well. The horses are attached to a spindle by cord that winds around the spindle when turned. The horses are set up on the table, the handle turned, and the horses approach the winning post. The speed of the horses depends on the way the cord winds, giving the chance of a different winner each time. The game components are all cardboard or cord

Every player has four round discs with frog pictures on them: a small, 2 medium, and a big disc. Every player tries to catapult the frogs in the packaging tube ("well") or a surrounding area marked with a paper ring ("Neigborhood") - frogs in the well count with point value.

Everyone uses his catapult at the same time, one may collect frogs outside the well again and catapult them again, as long as one player has placed all frogs in the well or neighborhood.

There is also an expansion kit with 2 additional catapults and frogs in 2 additional colors.

Varázstorony (roughly translated: Magical Tower) is a light fantasy wargame published only in Hungary.
Four races struggle for the ruling of the kingdom with the help of their mighty armies and magic: the humans, the orcs, the elves and the dwarves. The one who can collect enough power (control enough areas) and can enter the Tower with his mage will rise victorious.
Each races have different abilities in battle and have their own spells. The usage of magic is limited by the terrain. Because the modularity of the board, differently shaped and sized areas form the map.

Cluedo-like game from a TV show.
The players try to find treasures and move by helicopter on the map.
Introduced from a famous dj of '80: Jacques "Jocelyn" Antoine.

El Morocco is based on the movie Casablanca. The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate $500,000. You can make money to win in many different ways, but the best way is to gamble in one of the four different casinos. You can also get money by scheming and intrigue. Outwit blackmailers, thieves and spies. But beware of ending up on Devil’s Island.

Described in the book Calculate!, Away Across is a game where players try to connect opposite sides of a 10x10 board of 100 numbers.

Play makes use of a calculator, though can be done by hand. A player selects a square on the board and a number that is entered into the calculator. The second player multiples this number by another number. Play then alternates between players, marking and subtracting values on the board from the running difference with the person who gets the value to zero or lower claiming the set of marked values of his or her color.

The winner is the player who connects his or her two edges of the board with captured sets.
Rummy style game from the 60's.

Adventure game from the '70s based on a TV show. Each player receives a helicopter, site cards and treasure cards. The board shows 5 continents each with 6 sites with possible treasures on them. Helicopters are moved with a die roll but players can only fly their helicopter when they also play a fuel card. Each treasure has a value which is increased if you also have the card of that treasure and decreased if one of your competitors has the treasure card of the discovered treasure. At the end of the game the player who has most points wins, that is not necessarily the person with the most treasures.

name.value: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok
Confrontation: The Age of Rag'Narok – Ram Army Box
Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok – Lion Army Box
Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok – Wolven Army Box

item.description:
Confrontation and Rag'narok merge into one game: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok. No longer played with single miniatures (Confrontation) or massive units (Rag'narok), each player commands several small units of two to fifteen miniatures. Completely new concepts like Elixir Points and Tactics were added to this game, while it still uses many of the well-known Confrontation traits like an abundance of special abilities and the use of profile cards to determine the activation sequence. The core rules along with profiles for several of the factions are available for download (free of charge) on Rackham's website.

Re-implements:

 Confrontation
 Rag'narok
